a.title: The logical name of the element

a.title: Describes the severity of the adverse event, in relation to the subject not the resulting condition. In the context of clinical research, it is the investigator's assessment of severity. For cancer related trials, severity is represented as a grade.

description.value: Describes the severity of the adverse event, in relation to the subject not the resulting condition. In the context of clinical research, it is the investigator's assessment of severity. For cancer related trials, severity is represented as a grade.

definition.value: Describes the severity of the adverse event, in relation to the subject not the resulting condition. In the context of clinical research, it is the investigator's assessment of severity. For cancer related trials, severity is represented as a grade.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://build.fhir.org/extensibility.html) for a list).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://build.fhir.org/extensibility.html) for a list).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Describes the severity of the adverse event, in relation to the subject not the resulting condition. In the context of clinical research, it is the investigator's assessment of severity. For cancer related trials, severity is represented as a grade.
